channel.title: Projects on Damaris Zurell research
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Damaris Zurell research

item.title: BeyondSpecies
item.description: Predicting biodiversity change by integrating genetic diversity into ecological niche models - Leibniz Cooperative Excellence Project (2021-2024)

item.title: Audiomonitoring
item.description: Automated bioacoustic monitoring of birds, bats and insects.

item.title: RangeShiftR
item.description: The RangeShifter platform - an eco-evolutionary modelling framework.

item.title: COMECO
item.description: Improved automated image recognition for identifying plants of Switzerland - Interdisciplinary project funded by the Swiss Data Science Center (2020-2022).

item.title: RangeDyna
item.description: Moving from pattern towards process for improved forecasts of species range dynamics - DAAD research exchange with Univ. Melbourne (2019-2020).

item.title: BIOPIC
item.description: Understanding population and community response to global change - Emmy Noether project funded by the German Science Foundation DFG (2018-2023).

item.title: SCODA
item.description: Scaling from individual interactions to community dynamics in avian assemblages - Ambizione project funded by the Swiss National Science Foundation SNF (2016-2019).

item.title: SPEEDMIND
item.description: Improving species biodiversity analyses and citizen science feedback - Interdisciplinary project funded by the Swiss Data Science Center (2017-2019).

item.title: MATES
item.description: Understanding and predicting multispecies assemblages and interactions - Marie Curie fellowship funded by FP7 (2014-2016).

item.title: PhD thesis
item.description: Improve species range predictions for scenarios of environmental change - PhD research (2007-2011).
